intro: Pabstiella trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed pabstiella, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive trifid (three-lobed) leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to specific regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile, it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant's structure and growth habits make it a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is considered a valuable species for ecological and taxonomic research.
